00048 // get material id
00049 static PyObject * getMaterialID (PyObject *self, PyObject *args)
00050 {
00051     // parameters - game object with video texture
00052     PyObject * obj = NULL;
00053     // material name
00054     char * matName;
00055 
00056     // get parameters
00057     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "Os:materialID", &obj, &matName))
00058         return NULL;
00059     // get material id
00060     short matID = getMaterialID(obj, matName);
00061     // if material was not found, report errot
00062     if (matID < 0)
00063     {
00064         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError, "VideoTexture.materialID(ob, string): Object doesn't have material with given name");
00065         return NULL;
00066     }
00067     // return material ID
00068     return Py_BuildValue("h", matID);
00069 }
00070 
00071 
00072 // get last error description
00073 static PyObject * getLastError (PyObject *self, PyObject *args)
00074 {
00075     return PyUnicode_FromString(Exception::m_lastError.c_str());
00076 }
00077 
00078 // set log file
00079 static PyObject * setLogFile (PyObject *self, PyObject *args)
00080 {
00081     // get parameters
00082     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "s:setLogFile", &Exception::m_logFile))
00083         return Py_BuildValue("i", -1);
00084     // log file was loaded
00085     return Py_BuildValue("i", 0);
00086 }
00087 
00088 
00089 // image to numpy array
00090 static PyObject * imageToArray (PyObject * self, PyObject *args)
00091 {
00092     // parameter is Image object
00093     PyObject * pyImg;
00094     char *mode = NULL;
00095     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O|s:imageToArray", &pyImg, &mode) || !pyImageTypes.in(Py_TYPE(pyImg)))
00096     {
00097         // if object is incorect, report error
00098         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError, "VideoTexture.imageToArray(image): The value must be a image source object");
00099         return NULL;
00100     }
00101     // get image structure
00102     PyImage * img = reinterpret_cast<PyImage*>(pyImg);
00103     return Image_getImage(img, mode);
00104 }

00107 // metody modulu
00108 static PyMethodDef moduleMethods[] =
00109 {
00110     {"materialID", getMaterialID, METH_VARARGS, "Gets object's Blender Material ID"},
00111     {"getLastError", getLastError, METH_NOARGS, "Gets last error description"},
00112     {"setLogFile", setLogFile, METH_VARARGS, "Sets log file name"},
00113     {"imageToArray", imageToArray, METH_VARARGS, "get buffer from image source, color channels are selectable"},
00114     {NULL}  /* Sentinel */
00115 };

00137 static void registerAllTypes(void)
00138 {
00139 #ifdef WITH_FFMPEG
00140     pyImageTypes.add(&VideoFFmpegType, "VideoFFmpeg");
00141     pyImageTypes.add(&ImageFFmpegType, "ImageFFmpeg");
00142 #endif
00143     pyImageTypes.add(&ImageBuffType, "ImageBuff");
00144     pyImageTypes.add(&ImageMixType, "ImageMix");
00145     pyImageTypes.add(&ImageRenderType, "ImageRender");
00146     pyImageTypes.add(&ImageMirrorType, "ImageMirror");
00147     pyImageTypes.add(&ImageViewportType, "ImageViewport");
00148 
00149     pyFilterTypes.add(&FilterBlueScreenType, "FilterBlueScreen");
00150     pyFilterTypes.add(&FilterGrayType, "FilterGray");
00151     pyFilterTypes.add(&FilterColorType, "FilterColor");
00152     pyFilterTypes.add(&FilterLevelType, "FilterLevel");
00153     pyFilterTypes.add(&FilterNormalType, "FilterNormal");
00154     pyFilterTypes.add(&FilterRGB24Type, "FilterRGB24");
00155     pyFilterTypes.add(&FilterRGBA32Type, "FilterRGBA32");
00156     pyFilterTypes.add(&FilterBGR24Type, "FilterBGR24");
00157 }

00159 static struct PyModuleDef VideoTexture_module_def = {
00160     {}, /* m_base */
00161     "VideoTexture",  /* m_name */
00162     "Module that allows to play video files on textures in GameBlender.",  /* m_doc */
00163     0,  /* m_size */
00164     moduleMethods,  /* m_methods */
00165     0,  /* m_reload */
00166     0,  /* m_traverse */
00167     0,  /* m_clear */
00168     0,  /* m_free */
00169 };
00170 
00171 PyObject* initVideoTexture(void) 
00172 {
00173     PyObject * m;
00174     
00175     // initialize GL extensions
00176     //bgl::InitExtensions(0);
00177 
00178     // prepare classes
00179     registerAllTypes();
00180     registerAllExceptions();
00181 
00182     if (!pyImageTypes.ready())
00183         return NULL;
00184     if (!pyFilterTypes.ready()) 
00185         return NULL;
00186     if (PyType_Ready(&TextureType) < 0) 
00187         return NULL;
00188 
00189     /* Use existing module where possible
00190      * be careful not to init any runtime vars after this */
00191     m = PyImport_ImportModule( "VideoTexture" );
00192     if (m) {
00193         Py_DECREF(m);
00194         return m;
00195     }
00196     else {
00197         PyErr_Clear();
00198     
00199         m = PyModule_Create(&VideoTexture_module_def);
00200         PyDict_SetItemString(PySys_GetObject("modules"), VideoTexture_module_def.m_name, m);
00201     }
00202     
00203     if (m == NULL) 
00204         return NULL;
00205 
00206     // initialize classes
00207     pyImageTypes.reg(m);
00208     pyFilterTypes.reg(m);
00209 
00210     Py_INCREF(&TextureType);
00211     PyModule_AddObject(m, (char*)"Texture", (PyObject*)&TextureType);
00212     PyModule_AddIntConstant(m, (char*)"SOURCE_ERROR", SourceError);
00213     PyModule_AddIntConstant(m, (char*)"SOURCE_EMPTY", SourceEmpty);
00214     PyModule_AddIntConstant(m, (char*)"SOURCE_READY", SourceReady);
00215     PyModule_AddIntConstant(m, (char*)"SOURCE_PLAYING", SourcePlaying);
00216     PyModule_AddIntConstant(m, (char*)"SOURCE_STOPPED", SourceStopped);
00217     
00218     // init last error description
00219     Exception::m_lastError = "";
00220     
00221     return m;
00222 }
